definition: to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
to beat the gong to clear the way/(fig.) to pave the way for sth

sentences.english: The waiting is over. The World Cup is about to kick off.
sentences.chinese: 漫长的等待终于结束了，南非世界杯即将鸣锣开战。

sentences.english: At any rate, the battle lines between Google and Microsoft are now clearly drawn.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，谷歌和微软已经鸣锣开战。

definition: to beat the gong to open a performance
to beat a gong/to sound the retreat
Tongluo or Tunglo township in Miaoli county 苗栗縣|苗栗县[Miao2 li4 xian4], northwest Taiwan
to beat the gong to recall troops (idiom); to order a retreat
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
to sound a bell/to raise the alarm
(of a store, stock market etc) to open for trading/to make the first transaction of the day
to beat the gong to clear the way/(fig.) to pave the way for sth
